courses.name: Elementary Hebrew I
courses.description: For beginners with no prior knowledge of Hebrew. Five hours of classroom instruction, with one hour lab work weekly.

courses.name: Elementary Hebrew II
courses.description: Five hours of classroom instruction, with one hour lab work weekly.
courses.prerequisites: C- or better in HEBREW 1100, or equivalent

courses.name: Topics in Hebrew-General
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics. Subjects and topics may vary semester to semester. May be repeated with departmental consent.

courses.name: Topics in Hebrew - Humanities
courses.description: Organized study of selected topics. Subjects and topics may vary semester to semester. May be repeated with departmental consent. No knowledge of Hebrew required. No language credit.

courses.name: Problems in Hebrew
courses.description: Supervised study of Hebrew language and/or culture.

courses.name: Introduction to Israeli Culture
courses.description: Examines unique qualities that shape modern Israeli culture; looks at major social and political events that have shaped ethnicity, ideology, religion, identity, and diversity of the State of Israel. Discusses literature, the fine arts, language, and the mass media. No Foreign Language credit. Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Modern Israeli Film
courses.description: (same as FILM_SÂ 3845). Examines the modern film of developing Israel. Discusses complex social relationships. Introduces concepts of Hebrew language and its use in the arts world-wide. Discusses varied communities in Israel, and universal themes such as democracy and social justice. Provides introduction to Israeli culture. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: sophomore standing or instructor's consent required
